params._account: The address of account to add.
The address of account to add.

params.chunks: The list of encoded chunks, see the comments of `ChunkCodec`.
params.parentBatchHeader: The header of parent batch, see the comments of `BatchHeaderV0Codec`.
params.skippedL1MessageBitmap: The bitmap indicates whether each L1 message is skipped or not.

commitBatchWithBlobProof(uint8,bytes,byt.details: This function will revert unless all V0/V1/V2 batches are finalized. This is because we start to pop L1 messages in `commitBatchWithBlobProof` but not in `commitBatch`. We also introduce `finalizedQueueIndex` in `L1MessageQueue`. If one of V0/V1/V2 batches not finalized, `L1MessageQueue.pendingQueueIndex` will not match `parentBatchHeader.totalL1MessagePopped` and thus revert.

params.chunks: The list of encoded chunks, see the comments of `ChunkCodec`.
params.parentBatchHeader: The header of parent batch, see the comments of `BatchHeaderV0Codec`.
params.skippedL1MessageBitmap: The bitmap indicates whether each L1 message is skipped or not.

params._verifier: The address of zkevm verifier contract.

finalizeBatchWithProof4844(bytes,bytes32.details: Memory layout of `_blobDataProof`: ```text | z       | y       | kzg_commitment | kzg_proof | |---------|---------|----------------|-----------| | bytes32 | bytes32 | bytes48        | bytes48   | ```

params.aggrProof: The aggregation proof for current batch.
params.batchHeader: The header of current batch, see the encoding in comments of `commitBatch.
params.postStateRoot: The state root of current batch.
params.prevStateRoot: The state root of parent batch.
params.withdrawRoot: The withdraw trie root of current batch.

params.aggrProof: The aggregation proof for current bundle.
params.batchHeader: The header of last batch in current bundle, see the encoding in comments of `commitBatch.
params.postStateRoot: The state root after current bundle.
params.withdrawRoot: The withdraw trie root after current batch.

params._batchHeader: The header of the genesis batch.
params._stateRoot: The state root of the genesis block.

initialize(address,address,uint256).details: The parameters `_messageQueue` are no longer used.

params._maxNumTxInChunk: The maximum number of transactions allowed in each chunk.
params._verifier: The address of zkevm verifier contract.

returns._0: Whether the batch is finalized by batch index.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params._account: The address of account to remove.
The address of account to remove.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

revertBatch(bytes,bytes).details: If the owner want to revert a sequence of batches by sending multiple transactions,      make sure to revert recent batches first.

params.firstBatchHeader: The header of first batch to revert, see the encoding in comments of `commitBatch`.
params.lastBatchHeader: The header of last batch to revert, see the encoding in comments of `commitBatch`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addProver(address).notice: Add an account to the prover list.

addSequencer(address).notice: Add an account to the sequencer list.

commitBatch(uint8,bytes,bytes[],bytes).notice: Commit a batch of transactions on layer 1.

commitBatchWithBlobProof(uint8,bytes,byt.notice: Commit a batch of transactions on layer 1 with blob data proof.

finalizeBatchWithProof4844(bytes,bytes32.notice: Finalize a committed batch (with blob) on layer 1.

finalizeBundleWithProof(bytes,bytes32,by.notice: Finalize a list of committed batches (i.e. bundle) on layer 1.

isProver(address).notice: Whether an account is a prover.

isSequencer(address).notice: Whether an account is a sequencer.

layer2ChainId().notice: The chain id of the corresponding layer 2 chain.

maxNumTxInChunk().notice: The maximum number of transactions allowed in each chunk.

removeProver(address).notice: Add an account from the prover list.

removeSequencer(address).notice: Remove an account from the sequencer list.
